body: Even though 1fichier maximum allowed file size is 300GB rclone cant upload a 114GB file. giving fille too big error.

> Ok, looks like the limit was increased after the initial code from 100 GB to 300 GB.
> 
> @gyutw Do you want to send a PR for changing this?
> 
> It should be as simple as changing `100e9` to `300e9` at
> 
> https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/41ec712aa961e01a3d8bacc3a0b17a2b73344210/backend/fichier/fichier.go#L326

I cant find this file, where should it be?
Do you have the source cloned to your local system? The file is present at `backend/fichier/fichier.go`

> Do you have the source cloned to your local system? The file is present at `backend/fichier/fichier.go`

I installed using the curl command.
Ok, then you can edit it online and send the PR via this method: https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/managing-files-in-a-repository/editing-files-in-your-repository

issue.title: Update fichier.go

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, Amazon Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Cloudfiles, Google Cloud Storage, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Changing the maximum file size allowed

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4634

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
> Ok, then you can edit it online and send the PR via this method: https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/managing-files-in-a-repository/editing-files-in-your-repository

File edited, now how can I update the rclone on my server? Sorry for dumb question, first time doing this in Github.

Ah, I think you did it on your fork which will require extra steps for getting usable builds. You need to do it on this repo, not the fork which will create a PR (that needs to be merged by ncw) and also the builds for testing.

> Ah, I think you did it on your fork which will require extra steps for getting usable builds. You need to do it on this repo, not the fork which will create a PR (that needs to be merged by ncw) and also the builds for testing.

Now I am completely confused :))

When I tried editing it here, it says I should be on a branch, so I forked and edited the file.
Do you mean I should wait for the update from the rclone author?
No, just select the master branch in the top left section. You can use this link for the file to edit: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/backend/fichier/fichier.go

> No, just select the master branch in the top left section. You can use this link for the file to edit: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/backend/fichier/fichier.go

This is done, now how to update the rclone in my server?
Wait for the builds to get generated after the commit is merged.

> Wait for the builds to get generated after the commit is merged.

Sure. Do you mean it will update the code in my server automatically?
No, you will need to download them when they are ready after the commit is merged.

> No, you will need to download them when they are ready after the commit is merged.

It is still in progress, should I run this after it got completed?
git pull rclone

> No, you will need to download them when they are ready after the commit is merged.

It is failed! It was stuck on "install go" step for MAC.
Thanks for the fix! I've merged this into the latest beta which you can download [here](https://beta.rclone.org/).
